solution_line_template: The number of shoes the factory made was {num_dolls} dolls x {shoes_per_doll} shoes/doll = <<{num_dolls}*{shoes_per_doll}={total_shoes}>>{total_shoes} shoes
The factory also made for each doll {num_dolls} dolls x {bags_per_doll} bags/doll = <<{num_dolls}*{bags_per_doll}={total_bags}>>{total_bags} bags
The set of cosmetics made for each doll was just one, so there are <<{num_dolls}={total_cosmetics}>>{total_cosmetics} cosmetics sets
Finally, the number of hats for the dolls was {num_dolls} dolls x {hats_per_doll} hats/doll = <<{num_dolls}*{hats_per_doll}={total_hats}>>{total_hats} hats

In total, the number of accessories was {total_shoes} + {total_bags} + {total_cosmetics} + {total_hats} = <<{total_shoes}+{total_bags}+{total_cosmetics}+{total_hats}={total_accessories_count}>>{total_accessories_count} accessories
The dolls took in total {num_dolls} dolls x {time_per_doll} seconds/doll = <<{num_dolls}*{time_per_doll}={total_doll_time}>>{total_doll_time} seconds to be made

All the accessories also took {total_accessories_count} accessories x {time_per_accessory} seconds/accessory = <<{total_accessories_count}*{time_per_accessory}={total_accessory_time}>>{total_accessory_time} seconds

Combing both results, we have that the total time the machinery was working was {total_accessory_time} + {total_doll_time} = <<{total_accessory_time}+{total_doll_time}={total_combined_time}>>{total_combined_time} seconds
